issue.title: chore: improve `bor server --help`
issue.body:
# Description

- Remove defaults from flags description as it's already shown when using `bor server --help`.

```sh
# example for `txarrivalwait` flag
# before
$ bor server --help
...
-txarrivalwait
    Maximum duration to wait for a transaction before explicitly requesting it (defaults to 500ms) (default: 500ms)

# after
$ bor server --help
...
-txarrivalwait
    Maximum duration to wait for a transaction before explicitly requesting it (default: 500ms)
...
```

- Update docs using `make docs`. I've seen that docs haven't been updated since a long time, I can make a follow-up PR with a CI job if you guys want :)
- Doc generation is now deterministic (flags are now sorted).
- Sort flags in `bor server --help`.

## Before

![Screenshot 2023-10-26 at 21 03 47](https://github.com/maticnetwork/bor/assets/28714795/69bcf978-9057-40b3-a975-c6419e671e19)

## After

![Screenshot 2023-10-26 at 21 04 34](https://github.com/maticnetwork/bor/assets/28714795/161cc8ca-ce3a-42b6-976c-fb8490fb3658)

# Changes

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change that solves an issue)
- [ ] Hotfix (change that solves an urgent issue, and requires immediate attention)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change that adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (change that is not backwards-compatible and/or changes current functionality)
- [ ] Changes only for a subset of nodes

# Breaking changes

Please complete this section if any breaking changes have been made, otherwise delete it

# Nodes audience

In case this PR includes changes that must be applied only to a subset of nodes, please specify how you handled it (e.g. by adding a flag with a default value...)

- [ ] I have added at least 2 reviewer or the whole pos-v1 team
- [ ] I have added sufficient documentation in code
- [ ] I will be resolving comments - if any - by pushing each fix in a separate commit and linking the commit hash in the comment reply
- [ ] Created a task in Jira and informed the team for implementation in Erigon client (if applicable)
- [ ] Includes RPC methods changes, and the Notion documentation has been updated

# Cross repository changes

- [ ] This PR requires changes to heimdall
    - In case link the PR here:
- [ ] This PR requires changes to matic-cli
    - In case link the PR here:

## Testing

- [ ] I have added tests to CI

issue.title: call returned result of length 312928 exceeding limit 100000
issue.body:
How to start node with worked zero limit

  -rpc.returndatalimit
    Maximum size (in bytes) a result of an rpc request could have (default=100000, use 0 for no limits) (default: 100000)

I'm added in config.toml next line
rpc.returndatalimit = 0
rpc.batchlimit = 0
and add in command line 
ps ax | grep bor
34332 pts/5    Ssl+  10:58 ./bor server -rpc.returndatalimit=0 -rpc.batchlimit=0 -config ../config.toml

But I still get the error
            [error] => Array
                (
                    [code] => -32000
                    [message] => call returned result of length 312928 exceeding limit 100000
                )

How to configure the server so that there are no restrictions?

comment.body:
"rpc.batchlimit" = 0
"rpc.returndatalimit" = 500000
We need to quickly release an update and are too lazy to make a normal config parser.

Adding quotes to the config solves the problem.

# Description

issue.title: bor node stuck without any error msg
issue.body:
#### **System information**

Bor client version: v0.4.0

Heimdall client version: v0.3.4

OS & Version:  Linux (Ubuntu20.04)

Environment: Polygon Mainnet

Type of node:  Sentry

Additional Information: <!--Modifications in the client (if any)-->

#### **Overview of the problem**

Please describe the issue you experiencing.

After the hard fork upgrade, I upgrade my node from v0.3.3 to v0.4.0.

Sometimes the node is stuck. When the node is stuck, the block number is fixed in number, and I only see the log below.

I keep it for 20 hrs, but it still did not sync any new blocks.

This problem happens once a week.





#### **Reproduction Steps**

Sorry, I can't reproduce it.

#### **Logs / Traces / Output / Error Messages**
 
```
Jul 21 09:35:18 polygon02 bor[3966168]: WARN [07-21|09:35:18.517] Served eth_call                          reqid=151007   duration="178.765µs"  err="header not found"

issue.title: Failed to fetch latest milestone for whitelisting err="context deadline exceeded"
issue.body:
Hello.
heimdall v1.0.1
